isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - TROUBLESHOOTING (INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHT DIAGNOSTICS) - HIGH BEAM INDICATOR

svcsubproc.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With International Turn Signal Switch

table.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With International Turn Signal Switch

entry.para: Loosen cluster, remove high beam indicator bulb, and test for open condition.
Replace defective bulb and repeat test if problem persists.
Re-install bulb, disconnect connector (27), move headlight switch to on, and dimmer switch to high beam position. Measure voltage from connector (27) pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
With switches still set, measure voltage at connector (27) from pin 4/circuit 52A to pin 2/circuit 28-GA.
High beam circuits check good. If light fails to turn off, check relay or switch.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GA or 11-G, then repair.
Remove lift-to-dim relay (274) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 51A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 50, 50B, switch and conn. (35) or circuit 51A, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (274), measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51C, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (274), measure voltage from circuit 51A to 51D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, switch and conn. (458), circuit 51-G or 11-G to cab ground, then repair.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (274) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (274) by applying +12V to pin 85, gnd. to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay. With headlight switch in on position and dimmer switch in high beam position, at connector (27) measure voltage from pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
Circuits to cluster check good. Reconnect cluster. If warning light fails to illuminate, replace defective cluster.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52C or 52A, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Signal-Stat 910 Turn Signal Switch

table.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Signal-Stat 910 Turn Signal Switch

entry.para: Loosen cluster, remove high beam indicator bulb, and test for open condition.
Replace defective bulb and repeat test if problem persists.
Re-install bulb, disconnect connector (27), move headlight switch to on, and dimmer switch to high beam position. Measure voltage from connector (27) pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
With switches still set, measure voltage at connector (27) from pin 4/circuit 52A to pin 2/circuit 28-GA.
High beam circuits check good. Reconnect conn. (27) and replace cluster if warning light fails to illuminate.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GA or 11-G, then repair.
Remove connector (17) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 51F to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 50, switch and conn. (35) or circuit 51 or 51F, then repair.
On switch half of connector (17), measure resistance from green wire to brown wire with switch in high beam position.
Reconnect connector (17), and with switches still set, at connector (27), measure voltage from circuit 52A to ground.
Circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (27) and replace cluster if warning light fails to illuminate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52F or 52A, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Signal-Stat 915 Turn Signal Switch With Push Button Dimmer

table.title: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Signal-Stat 915 Turn Signal Switch With Push Button Dimmer

entry.para: Loosen cluster, remove high beam indicator bulb, and test for open condition.
Replace defective bulb and repeat test if problem persists.
Re-install bulb, disconnect connector (27), move headlight switch to on, and dimmer switch to high beam position. Measure voltage from connector (27) pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
With switches still set, measure voltage at connector (27) from pin 4/circuit 52A to pin 2/circuit 28-GA.
High beam circuits check good. If light fails to turn off, check relay or switch.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-GA or 11-G, then repair.
Remove lift-to-dim relay (276) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 51B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 50, switch and conn. (35), circuit 51 or 50F, conn. (17), or circuit 51B, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (276), measure voltage from circuit 50E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 63 or 50E from fuse F7, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (276), measure voltage from circuit 51B to 51-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-GA, switch and conn. (421), circuit 52-GA or 11-G to cab ground, then repair.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (276) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (276) by applying +12V to pin 85, gnd. to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay. With headlight switch in on position and dimmer switch in high beam position, at connector (27) measure voltage from pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
Circuits to cluster check good. Reconnect cluster. If warning light fails to illuminate, replace defective cluster.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52D, conn. (17), circuit 52F or 52A, then repair.
Loosen cluster, remove high beam indicator bulb, and test for open condition.
Replace defective bulb and repeat test if problem persists.
Re-install bulb, disconnect connector (11), move headlight switch to on, and dimmer switch to high beam position. Measure voltage from connector (11) pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
With switches still set, measure voltage at connector (11) from pin 4/circuit 52A to pin 2/circuit 28-G.
High beam circuits check good. Reconnect conn. (11) and replace cluster if warning light fails to illuminate.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-G, 11-GB, or 11-G, then repair.
Remove connector (27) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 51 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 50, switch and conn. (23) or circuit 51, then repair.
On switch half of connector (27), measure resistance from green wire to brown wire with switch in high beam position.
Reconnect connector (27), and with switches still set, at connector (11), measure voltage from circuit 52A to ground.
Circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (11) and replace cluster if warning light fails to illuminate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52F or 52A, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: 3000RE With Douglas Tilt Column and Switch

table.title: 3000RE With Douglas Tilt Column and Switch

entry.para: Loosen cluster, remove high beam indicator bulb, and test for open condition.
Replace defective bulb and repeat test if problem persists.
Re-install bulb, disconnect connector (11), move headlight switch to on, and dimmer switch to high beam position. Measure voltage from connector (11) pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
With switches still set, measure voltage at connector (11) from pin 4/circuit 52A to pin 2/circuit 28-G.
High beam circuits check good. Reconnect conn. (11) and replace cluster if warning light fails to illuminate.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-G, 11-GB, or 11-G, then repair.
Remove connector (4) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 51 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 50, switch and conn. (23) or circuit 51, then repair.
On switch half of connector (4), measure resistance from green wire to brown wire with switch in high beam position.
Reconnect connector (4), and with switches still set, at connector (11), measure voltage from circuit 52A to ground.
Circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (11) and replace cluster if warning light fails to illuminate.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52 or 52A, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: 3000RE With Stationary Column and International Turn Signal Switch

table.title: 3000RE With Stationary Column and International Turn Signal Switch

entry.para: Loosen cluster, remove high beam indicator bulb, and test for open condition.
Replace defective bulb and repeat test if problem persists.
Re-install bulb, disconnect connector (11), move headlight switch to on, and dimmer switch to high beam position. Measure voltage from connector (11) pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
With switches still set, measure voltage at connector (11) from pin 4/circuit 52A to pin 2/circuit 28-G.
High beam circuits check good. If light fails to turn off, check relay or switch.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-G, 11-GB, or 11-G, then repair.
Remove lift-to-dim relay (100) and with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 51A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 50, switch and conn. (23), circuit 66 or 51A, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (100), measure voltage from circuit 51F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51F, then repair.
With switches still set, at relay socket (100), measure voltage from circuit 51F to 51D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, switch and conn. (6), circuit 51-G or 11-G to cab ground, then repair.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (100) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (100) by applying +12V to pin 85, gnd. to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay. With headlight switch in on position and dimmer switch in high beam position, at connector (11) measure voltage from pin 4/circuit 52A to ground.
Circuits to cluster check good. Reconnect cluster. If warning light fails to illuminate, replace defective cluster.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52C or 52A, then repair.
